name: south-africa-development-cooperation-system
notes:
Project level information about Official Development Assistance (ODA) to South African Government. Also 1994-present overview of ODA to South Africa broken down by development partner (not exportable)
## Details
The database only includes aid received by Government Departments. NGO/private recipients are not listed. The information is intended for ODA management professionals, stakeholders, other interested parties and the general public. The South African Government became a recipient of ODA in 1994.
National Treasury Vision 2005:The Treasury aims to promote economic development, good governance, social progress and rising living standards through accountable, economic, efficient, equitable and sustainable management of public finances.

extras.value: Navigate from URL to ODA reports. Reports catagorised in to a number of sections, click on any to get you through to the database. This is very slow. Can change type of report at bottom of page. Search for project codes 1-10000 (for example) to get list of all projects for downloading. Help on navigation unsatisfactory. The overview of ODA to SA broken down by development partner is in => ODA reports => ODA to SA.Many links on website broken.
No (all projects but not all project information)
Information provided by donor counties- this could produce incomplete entries although none were specifically found.

IDC, National Treasury, 15th Floor, 240 Vermeulen Street, Pretoria, '0002, South AfricaTel. +27 12 315 5969, Tel. +27 12 315 5111 (Main Switchboard)Fax. +27 12 324 2456Postal Address: Private Bag X 115, Pretoria

Title, Project_Code, Donor ID, BAS/FMS_ID, Objective, Results, Status, Comments, Start Date, End Date, Duration, Donor, Recipient, Sector, ODA Type, Project Stage, Region, Aid Effectiveness, Contact List, Budget, Financial Information - Donor Contribution, RDP Fund Finance Transactions

The database only includes aid received by Government Departments. NGO/private recipients are not listed. The information is intended for ODA management professionals, stakeholders, other interested parties and the general public. The South African Government became a recipient of ODA in 1994.National Treasury Vision 2005:The Treasury aims to promote economic development, good governance, social progress and rising living standards through accountable, economic, efficient, equitable and sustainable management of public finances.
Under "ODA - Related Documents" on left bar

Project level information about Official Development Assistance (ODA) to South African Government. Also 1994-present overview of ODA to South Africa broken down by development partner (not exportable)
Shaheed Rajie (Chief Director), Elaine Venter (Director), Robin Toli (Director)

Agriculture/Forestry/Fishing, Banking & Financial Services, Business & Other Service, Communications, Criminal Justice, Education, Emergency Assistance, Employment, Energy Generation and Supply, Gender and Youth, General Enviromental Protection, Government and Civil Society, Health,Housing, Industry, Mining & Construction, Multi-Sector, Other Social Services, Population Policies and Programmes, Trade, Investment Promotion and Tourism, Transport and Storage, Water Supply and Sanitation
As each project has new data
Data gathered through the completion of a set of proforma sent to each donor institution.
Data collected from donors, SA implementing agencies used for testing/ quality assurance purposes.

Development Assistance Committee (DAC) of the Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD) defines Official Development Assistance (ODA) as “… (resource) flows to developing countries and multilateral institutions provided by official agencies, including state and local governments, or by their executive agencies, each transaction of which meets the following test: a) it is administered with the promotion of the economic development and welfare of developing countries as its main objective, and b) it is concessional in character and contains a grant element of at least 25 per cent (calculated at a rate of discount of 10%)”.In this document, the concept ODA is used in a more restricted sense, referring to:Official resource flows from the international donor community to South Africa in the form of grants, technical co-operation and financial co-operation , where the South African Government is held at least partially responsible or accountable for the management of such resources.
South Africa Development Co-operation Information System
